days.title: Departure from Wroc≈Çaw
days.tagline: Two flights, one dream. Korea & Japan, here we come.
highlights: Pack snacks ‚Äî it's a long journey!
days.food: Airport food in Copenhagen. Stock up on snacks for the long haul to Seoul.
days.tip: Copenhagen has good duty-free. Grab Danish pastries for the Seoul flight.

days.title: Arrival in Seoul
days.tagline: Annyeonghaseyo! Landing in the city that never sleeps.
highlights: AREX train to Seoul Station ‚Äî 43 min, ‚Ç©9,500
Evening walk ‚Äî Myeongdong or Namdaemun Market
days.food: Late dinner: Korean BBQ near hotel, or street food at Myeongdong (tteokbokki, hotteok).
days.tip: Get a T-money card at the airport for all public transport in Seoul.

days.title: Seoul: Palaces & K-Culture
days.tagline: Ancient palaces meet neon-lit streets. Seoul is a time machine.
highlights: 13:00 ‚Äî Insadong ‚Äî art galleries, tea houses, street food
15:00 ‚Äî Namsan Tower (N Seoul Tower) ‚Äî city panorama

transport.note: Seoul Metro ‚Äî T-money card works everywhere

days.food: Lunch: bibimbap at Insadong. Dinner: Korean fried chicken in Hongdae (try Kyochon or BBQ).
days.tip: Rent hanbok near Gyeongbokgung for free palace entry + amazing photo ops.

days.title: Seoul ‚Üí Tokyo
days.tagline: Two capitals in one day. Seoul to Tokyo in 2 hours flat.
highlights: 10:20 ‚Äî Arrive Tokyo, train to hotel in K≈çt≈ç-ku
18:00 ‚Äî First ramen in Tokyo. Welcome to Japan.
days.food: Welcome-to-Japan ramen ‚Äî find a local spot near the hotel. Konbini for snacks.
days.tip: Buy Suica/PASMO card at the airport. Get pocket WiFi too.

days.title: Tokyo: Full Immersion
days.tagline: From kitchen streets to Shibuya crossing. Tokyo at full speed.
highlights: 10:30 ‚Äî Kappabashi D≈çgugai Kitchen Town ‚Äî knife shopping!
12:00 ‚Äî Ueno Park ‚Äî temples, shrines, cherry trees
14:00 ‚Äî Gotokuji Temple ‚Äî the lucky cat temple
18:00 ‚Äî Shibuya Crossing ‚Üí Shibuya Sky observation deck ‚Äî ¬•2,000

transport.note: Tokyo Metro ‚Äî Suica card. Lots of walking!

days.food: Kappabashi area for lunch. Shibuya for dinner ‚Äî try tonkatsu or gyudon. FamilyMart for midnight snacks.
days.tip: This is an INTENSE day. Prioritize your top 6-7 spots and save the rest for Day 7.

days.title: Kamakura & Mount Fuji
days.tagline: Zen temples in the morning, Fuji-san by afternoon. Epic day trip.
highlights: 15:30 ‚Äî ≈åishi Park ‚Äî lakeside flower park with Fuji views
16:30 ‚Äî Mt. Fuji Panoramic Ropeway ‚Äî cable car over Kawaguchiko
days.food: Kamakura: shirasu-don (whitebait rice bowl) ‚Äî local specialty. Fuji area: h≈çt≈ç noodles.
days.tip: This is geographically ambitious (Kamakura is south, Fuji is west). Consider splitting or renting a car for Fuji portion.

days.title: Tokyo Morning ‚Üí Kyoto
days.tagline: Imperial gardens, then shinkansen west. Next stop: ancient capital.
highlights: 08:30 ‚Äî Imperial Palace East Gardens ‚Äî free, beautiful
10:00 ‚Äî Chidorigafuchi ‚Äî moat walk, iconic cherry blossom spot
12:00 ‚Äî Lunch in Tokyo, pack up hotel
16:15 ‚Äî Arrive Kyoto, check into KOKO Residence near Nij≈ç-j≈ç
days.food: Last Tokyo lunch ‚Äî sushi near the station. Kyoto evening: tofu kaiseki or simple ramen.
days.tip: Shinkansen tickets with JR Pass ‚Äî take Hikari (not Nozomi). Reserve window seat for views.

days.title: Kyoto: Temples, Art & Geisha Streets
days.tagline: Golden pavilions, digital art, and the sound of wooden geta on stone.
highlights: 10:00 ‚Äî teamLab Biovortex Kyoto ‚Äî immersive digital art
12:00 ‚Äî Kyoto Imperial Palace ‚Äî free, reserve online
14:00 ‚Äî Hanamikoji Street ‚Äî geisha district, traditional feel
15:00 ‚Äî Yasaka Shrine ‚Üí K≈çdai-ji ‚Üí Yasaka Pagoda walk

transport.note: Kyoto city buses + walking. Buy a bus day pass ¬•700.

days.food: Nishiki Market for lunch grazing. Evening: Pontocho alley along the river.
days.tip: Kinkaku-ji at 8:30am is magical with morning light. teamLab books out ‚Äî get tickets in advance!

days.title: Nara: Sacred Deer & Giant Buddha
days.tagline: Bow to the deer, they bow back. Then meet the world's largest bronze Buddha.
highlights: 09:30 ‚Äî T≈çdai-ji ‚Äî world's largest wooden building, giant Buddha ‚Äî ¬•600
11:00 ‚Äî Todaiji Kaidan Hall ‚Äî quieter, beautiful statues
14:00 ‚Äî Mount Wakakusa ‚Äî panoramic hike (30 min climb, free)
days.food: Nara: kakinoha-zushi (leaf-wrapped sushi), mochi from street vendors. Dinner back in Kyoto.
days.tip: Buy deer crackers (shika senbei, ¬•200) at official stands only. Deer are gentle but persistent!

days.title: Osaka: Food Capital of Japan
days.tagline: Kuidaore ‚Äî eat until you drop. Osaka takes this literally.
highlights: 09:30 ‚Äî Umeda Sky Building ‚Äî floating garden observatory ‚Äî ¬•1,500
11:00 ‚Äî Osaka Castle ‚Äî ¬•600, park is free and gorgeous
13:00 ‚Äî D≈çtonbori ‚Äî neon madness, street food heaven
16:00 ‚Äî Namba Yasaka Jinja ‚Äî giant lion head shrine
19:30 ‚Äî Harukas 300 ‚Äî Japan's tallest building observation deck ‚Äî ¬•1,500
days.food: D≈çtonbori: takoyaki (Kukuru), okonomiyaki (Mizuno), gyoza. Kuromon: fresh sashimi. Shinsekai: kushikatsu at Daruma.
days.tip: D≈çtonbori at night is ELECTRIC. Come back after Harukas for the neon madness.

days.title: Epic West: Himeji ‚Üí Onomichi ‚Üí Hiroshima ‚Üí Fukuoka
days.tagline: Four cities, one day. The shinkansen earns its keep today.
highlights: 08:30 ‚Äî Himeji Castle ‚Äî Japan's most beautiful castle ‚Äî ¬•1,000
10:30 ‚Äî Train to Onomichi ‚Äî ~1.5h ‚Äî charming port town
12:00 ‚Äî Onomichi Temple Walk ‚Äî hillside path with sea views
14:30 ‚Äî A-Bomb Dome & Peace Memorial ‚Äî powerful, essential
18:00 ‚Äî Arrive Fukuoka, check in. Yatai ramen dinner!
days.food: Onomichi: onomichi ramen (pork back fat!). Hiroshima: quick okonomiyaki. Fukuoka: yatai Hakata ramen ‚Äî the grand finale.
days.tip: This is the marathon day. Pack light, send big luggage via takkyubin (luggage forwarding) to Fukuoka hotel.

days.title: Kyushu Adventures: Rice Terraces to Hot Hells
days.tagline: Terraced rice fields, samurai castles, and boiling hot springs from hell.
highlights: 07:30 ‚Äî Drive/train to Eriyama Rice Terraces ‚Äî stunning sunrise paddy views
09:00 ‚Äî Dazaifu Tenmangu ‚Äî shrine of the learning god
10:30 ‚Äî Nyoirinji Frog Temple ‚Äî quirky, thousands of frog statues
14:30 ‚Äî Train to Yufuin ‚Äî charming onsen town
16:00 ‚Äî Beppu Jigoku (Hells of Beppu) ‚Äî steaming hot spring pools ‚Äî ¬•2,000
days.food: Kumamoto: basashi (horse sashimi) & karashi renkon. Beppu: jigoku-mushi (hell-steamed food ‚Äî cooked in hot spring steam!).
days.tip: This is VERY ambitious. Consider splitting: Dazaifu+Kumamoto one day, Yufuin+Beppu another. Or rent a car.

days.title: Takachiho Gorge & Mount Aso
days.tagline: Mythological gorges and an active volcano. Nature at its most dramatic.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Takachiho Gorge ‚Äî boat ride through volcanic ravine ‚Äî ¬•5,100/3 people
11:00 ‚Äî Amano Iwato Shrine ‚Äî cave of the sun goddess
13:00 ‚Äî Lunch in Takachiho ‚Äî local chicken nanban
14:30 ‚Äî Aso-Kuju National Park ‚Äî volcanic crater views
days.food: Takachiho: chicken nanban, nagashi somen (flowing noodles). Aso: red beef (akaushi).
days.tip: Takachiho boat ride books out fast! The gorge is otherworldly ‚Äî worth every yen.

days.title: Fukuoka Chill ‚Üí Okinawa
days.tagline: Zoo monkeys in the morning, tropical beaches by evening.
highlights: 10:30 ‚Äî Atago Shrine ‚Äî hilltop shrine with city views
17:00 ‚Äî Arrive Naha, check into Southern Beach Hotel
days.food: Fukuoka last lunch: mentaiko (spicy cod roe) everything. Okinawa dinner: goya champuru, Orion beer.
days.tip: Southern Beach Hotel has a great beach. Relax ‚Äî you've earned it after the Kyushu marathon.

days.title: Okinawa: Island Paradise
days.tagline: Tropical Japan. Turquoise water, Ryukyu castles, and island time.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Shuri Castle ‚Äî UNESCO World Heritage, Ryukyu Kingdom ‚Äî ¬•400
11:00 ‚Äî Kokusai Street ‚Äî souvenirs, Okinawan craft beer
12:30 ‚Äî Makishi Public Market ‚Äî fresh seafood upstairs cooking

transport.note: Okinawa has no trains outside Naha monorail. Rent a car for Churaumi (2h drive) or take express bus.

days.food: Makishi Market: pick fish downstairs, they cook it upstairs. Dinner: umibudo (sea grapes), rafute (pork belly), Okinawa soba.
days.tip: Churaumi Aquarium is 2h from Naha. Start early or rent a car. The whale shark tank is breathtaking.

days.title: Okinawa ‚Üí Seoul
days.tagline: One last island morning, then back to Seoul for the final night.
highlights: 18:00 ‚Äî Quick hotel check-in near Gangnam or Myeongdong
19:00 ‚Äî Final Korean BBQ feast ‚Äî go all out!
days.food: Last Korean BBQ: try samgyeopsal (pork belly) with soju. This is the farewell feast.
days.tip: Seoul is a great city for a final night out. Gangnam or Itaewon for nightlife.

days.title: Seoul Last Day & Departure
days.tagline: Morning kimchi, afternoon shopping, midnight flight home.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Late breakfast ‚Äî Korean juk (porridge) or brunch
16:00 ‚Äî Pack up, hotel checkout, head to airport
days.food: Gwangjang Market is a MUST ‚Äî bibimbap, japchae, sundae (blood sausage). K-beauty shopping on the side.
days.tip: Late flight means a full day in Seoul! Use it. Leave bags at hotel or station lockers.

days.title: Welcome Home
highlights: Unpack, sort photos, start planning the next trip
days.food: Home-cooked comfort food. You deserve it.
days.tip: Start a shared photo album ASAP while memories are fresh. And wash everything ‚Äî 18 days!

jrPassAnalysis.recommendation: 7-day or 14-day JR Pass depending on activation date strategy
jrPassAnalysis.note: Activate on Day 7 (Tokyo‚ÜíKyoto) for 7-day. Covers through Day 13.

transport.suicaCard: Buy Suica at Tokyo airport, T-money at Seoul airport

bookings.note: 1,300 PLN pp ‚Äî exchange at Tokyo station
May 1 ‚Äî 1 night near airport or Myeongdong

Hotels (15 nights).note: 5,400 PLN total / 7 people ‚Äî incredibly cheap for 15 nights!

Food.note: 18 days of eating ‚Äî mix of street food, markets, restaurants

Activities.note: Temples, museums, teamLab, Churaumi, boat rides

Local transport.note: T-money Seoul, Suica Tokyo, buses, taxis

budget.note: Hotels are amazingly cheap because 7 people share costs! Flights from CSV: total 2,206 PLN pp.

packing: Comfortable walking shoes (20k+ steps some days)
Universal adapter (Type A for Japan, Type C/F for Korea)

hotels.note: 7 adults sharing accommodations ‚Äî apartment-style preferred. Prices are total per booking, not per night.

options.name: Bilribeu Indosity Namsan
options.pickReason: Already booked! Great location for Namsan + Myeongdong.

options.name: Hotel J≈ç (K≈çt≈ç-ku)
options.pickReason: Already booked! Good value for 3 nights in Tokyo.

kyoto.purpose: Kansai base ‚Äî Kyoto, Nara, Osaka day trips

options.name: KOKO Residence Nij≈ç-j≈ç
options.pickReason: Already booked! Apartment with kitchen near Nij≈ç-j≈ç. Perfect for 7 people.

fukuoka.purpose: Kyushu base ‚Äî Kumamoto, Beppu, Takachiho day trips

options.name: Fukuoka Accommodation (TBD)
highlights: Near Hakata Station for day trips
options.pickReason: Not yet booked ‚Äî book near Hakata Station for easy day trip access.

options.name: Southern Beach Hotel & Resort
options.pickReason: Already booked! Beach resort with pool. Perfect wind-down after Kyushu.

restaurants.note: Restaurant picks for each city ‚Äî from CSV activities + local knowledge

spots.name: Gwangjang Market
spots.note: Historic market ‚Äî legendary street food stalls

spots.name: Myeongdong Street Food
spots.note: Tourist area but genuinely great street food

spots.name: Maple Tree House
spots.note: Upscale KBBQ ‚Äî worth the splurge for farewell dinner

spots.name: Ueno Ameyoko Market
spots.note: Near Ueno Park ‚Äî perfect for Day 5

spots.name: Shibuya Nonbei Yokocho
spots.note: Tiny atmospheric alley bars near Shibuya station

spots.name: Nishiki Market
spots.note: The Kitchen of Kyoto ‚Äî essential grazing

spots.name: Pontocho Alley
spots.note: Atmospheric alley along Kamo River. Pick any place with terrace.

spots.name: Kuromon Market
spots.mustTry: Fresh uni, wagyu skewers, king crab

spots.name: Daruma Kushikatsu
spots.mustTry: Kushikatsu ‚Äî deep-fried skewers. NO double dipping!
spots.note: Iconic Shinsekai chain ‚Äî look for the angry chef statue

spots.name: D≈çtonbori Street Food
spots.mustTry: Takoyaki at Kukuru, okonomiyaki at Mizuno
spots.note: The neon-lit food street. Come hungry.

spots.name: Nakasu Yatai
spots.mustTry: Hakata tonkotsu ramen at a yatai stall
spots.note: Iconic open-air food stalls along the river. Sit at the counter!

spots.name: Beppu Hell-Steamed Food
spots.mustTry: Jigoku-mushi ‚Äî food steamed in volcanic hot spring steam
spots.note: Only in Beppu! Eggs, veggies, seafood cooked by nature.

spots.name: Makishi Public Market
spots.mustTry: Pick fish downstairs, they cook it upstairs

spots.name: Yunangi
spots.mustTry: Goya champuru, rafute pork belly, umibudo (sea grapes)
spots.note: Best traditional Okinawan cuisine in Naha

Spring in Seoul ‚Äî cherry blossoms possible!

Late April Tokyo ‚Äî warm but can be rainy. Pack an umbrella.
Fuji area is 5-6¬∞C cooler. Bring a warm layer.
Perfect temple weather. Late cherry blossoms possible.
Perfect temple weather. Late cherry blossoms possible.
Great hiking weather for Mount Wakakusa.
Warm enough for just a t-shirt during the day.
Evening yatai stalls are rain or shine.
Mt Aso can be windy. Check volcanic activity alerts.
Subtropical! Sunscreen essential. Quick rain showers pass fast.
